title: Paddy's Lament, Ireland 1846-1847: Prelude to Hatred
description: Ireland in the mid-1800s was primarily a population of peasants, forced to live on a single, moderately nutritious crop: potatoes. Suddenly, in 1846, an unknown and uncontrollable disease turned the potato crop to inedible slime, and all Ireland was threatened.
author: Thomas Gallagher
